summary: This document is an email chain from July 24, 2019, regarding the medication administration for an inmate on Psychological Observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The correspondence involves a U.S. Public Health Service Chief Pharmacist discussing the inmate's claim of not receiving his constipation medication (docusate sodium/Colace).

persons.name: CAPT, U.S. Public Health Service Chief Pharmacist MCC New York
persons.context: The sender/recipient of the email chain, discussing the medication supply and administration for an inmate on Psychological Observation.

events.title: Inmate's medication filled
events.description: A 30-day supply of docusate sodium 100mg (Colace) was filled for the inmate.

events.title: Medication inquiry for inmate on Psychological Observation
events.description: Email correspondence regarding an inmate on Psychological Observation who claims he has not been receiving his constipation medication. The Chief Pharmacist notes the medication was filled on 7/12 and discusses ensuring the inmate receives it.
personsInvolved: CAPT, U.S. Public Health Service Chief Pharmacist MCC New York

locations.context: Address for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, where the Chief Pharmacist is based and the inmate is held.

keyFacts: The document is a confidential email chain dated July 24, 2019, concerning inmate medical care at MCC New York.
The subject inmate is on 'Psychological Observation' and reported not receiving his constipation medication (docusate sodium/Colace).
A 30-day supply of the medication was filled for the inmate on July 12, 2019.
The correspondence involves a U.S. Public Health Service Chief Pharmacist coordinating with medical staff to ensure medication administration.
The document is marked as potentially containing SENSITIVE information and is part of the SDNY evidence set (SDNY_00009758).
